meanings.definition: The act of causing someone to feel isolated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: Her constant criticism led to deep alienations within the family.
meanings.sent2: The alienations between the two friends grew as misunderstandings piled up.
meanings.sent3: The alienations between the siblings over who gets the last cookie were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The alienations in the classroom were like invisible walls separating the students.
meanings.sent5: The alienations in the workplace made collaboration nearly impossible.

meanings.definition: The state of being separated or disconnected from others.
meanings.sent1: His feelings of alienations intensified as he moved to a new city where he knew no one.
meanings.sent2: The alienations she felt after the argument made her realize the importance of communication.
meanings.sent3: The alienations at the party were so strong that even the music couldn't bring people together.
meanings.sent4: The alienations in the virtual world can sometimes feel more profound than in real life.
meanings.sent5: The alienations in the empty house echoed with loneliness.

meanings.definition: The transfer of property or rights to another person.
meanings.sent1: The alienations of land to the neighboring farmer were completed smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Legal documents were signed to finalize the alienations of ownership.
meanings.sent3: The alienations of the antique collection to the museum brought joy to many art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent4: The alienations of power within the organization shifted the dynamics significantly.
meanings.sent5: The alienations of responsibilities among the team members were clearly defined in the project plan.
